title: How the West Is Losing Ukraine
summary: Biden suggests a 'minor incursion' by Russia might divide the U.S. and Europe on how to respond.. Secretary of State Antony Blinken is visiting Europe this week in a frantic effort to deter a Russian invasion of Ukraine, and we hope he succeeds. But the Administration is also signaling that an invasion is likely, and if so it's worth explaining why deterrence will have failed.

title: No Course Correction for Joe Biden
summary: After a year in office, an unpopular President says full speed ahead.. President Biden took questions from the press for nearly two hours Wednesday, his 364th day in office, which would have been an opportune moment to announce a change in strategy or agenda. In one poll this week, 37% of voters graded his first year as an F, and another 12% gave it a D.

title: Iowa's Bold Tax Reform
summary: Gov. Reynolds proposes a big income tax cut and a 4% flat rate.. The economic recovery has state governments rolling in tax revenue, and most are spending the windfall, on pace to spend an average of 9.3% more than in 2021. Iowa's Kim Reynolds is among a handful of governors returning money to taxpayers to sustain the economic rebound.

title: Inflation Comes to the U.K. and Everywhere
summary: And no one seems eager to raise interest rates to address it.. In a spirit of misery loving company, Americans would like to welcome their European friends to the global inflation party. Recent data suggest price rises remain out of control in the Old World, and no one has a good plan to rein them in.

title: An Economic Evaluation of Covid Lockdowns
summary: The costs of prevention efforts have outweighed those from the direct effects of the virus itself.. As President Biden's first year of handling the pandemic comes to a close, many of his most ardent critics are pointing to the ugly numbers: More Americans have died from Covid-19 under the current president than under the previous one, despite the prevalence of vaccines and the development of other medical innovations. But as the pandemic's progression has made clear, public-health officials should aim to do more than merely minimize the spread of disease. They should seek to reduce the total harm caused by both infection and heavy-handed attempts to prevent it.

title: Green Party Supporters Deserve Voting Rights Too
summary: The Democrats belie their commitment to democracy by repeatedly suing to get the minor party off ballots.. Democrats have framed their voting-rights legislation as a "battle for the soul of America." President Biden last week said that "the right to vote and to have that vote counted is democracy's threshold liberty." But what about the right to a real choice?

title: 2022 Midterms Are a No-Win for Democrats
summary: Even a dramatic Biden administration reset wouldn't prevent them from losing big.. Anyone who's served on a White House staff, Democrat or Republican, has some sympathy for what President Biden and his team are going through. Crisis after crisis at home and abroad, a stalled legislative agenda, lousy polls, a divided party, plenty of critics-including usually friendly voices-and internal backbiting spilling into public view: Team Biden is beset by all this and more.

title: What Does a Library's 'Diversity Auditor' Do?
summary: Bard College says it aims at 'decanonizing the stacks' but that doesn't mean removing books.. The celebrated postmodern architect Robert Venturi added an extension to Bard College's Stevenson Library in 1993. His polychrome brick building-with a masking façade of yellow, orange, purple and olive panels-was intended to blend with the original library: an 1893 Greek-revival re-creation of the Parthenon.

title: A National Anthem Answer for Jon Stewart
summary: Why do fans stand? The tradition dates back to the 1918 World Series.. The other day Jon Stewart questioned why fans at sports events stand for the national anthem. "Does anyone know when that started?" he asked. "It's such a weird ritual."

title: 'Wannsee' Review: Planning the 'Final Solution'
summary: The clearest, most comprehensive surviving blueprint for the Holocaust-as damning as it is rare-was drafted by the Nazi leadership.. A single meeting can distill the essence of evil. Eighty years ago, on Jan. 20, 1942, Reinhard Heydrich, the head of the SS intelligence service and security police, presided over a high-level meeting with 14 Nazi colleagues at the elegant Wannsee villa near Berlin. The agenda: to discuss "the final solution of the Jewish question in Europe." At the gathering's conclusion, the event's invitation noted, breakfast would be served.

title: Progressive to Uyghurs: Drop Dead
summary: Joe Biden's foreign policy is about protecting Democrats' domestic spending, not U.S. security.. There are variations on the story about how to get a mule's attention, but we should thank Golden State Warriors minority owner Chamath Palihapitiya for hitting all of us over the head with a 2-by-4. As he put it in a now-famous podcast: "Nobody cares about what's happening to the Uyghurs, OK? You bring it up because you really care, and I think it's nice that you really care. The rest of us don't care."

title: United Airlines Says Omicron Variant to Slow Travel Rebound
summary: Carrier is scaling back its schedule amid falloff in demand, but says setback will be temporary. United Airlines Holdings Inc. said the emergence of the Omicron variant of Covid-19 dented near-term bookings and will slow its recovery, but said the setback is likely to be temporary.

title: Bitcoin Sags in 2022 Under Weight of Stock Selloff and Fed Policy
summary: Crypto markets mirror traditional markets with surge of institutional investors. The Federal Reserve is casting a shadow over cryptocurrencies.

title: Coachella Valley Home Sells for $42 Million
summary: Outside Palm Springs, the futuristic home of the late Duane Hagadone was listed for $49.5 million in November. A futuristic home outside Palm Springs, Calif., has sold for $42 million after listing in November for $49.5 million.

title: Prior Covid-19 Infection Offered Better Protection Than Vaccination During Delta Wave
summary: CDC says research from California and New York before Omicron's spread showed unvaccinated people without previous infection faced greatest risk. Surviving a previous infection provided better protection than vaccination against Covid-19 during the Delta wave, federal health authorities said, citing research showing that both the shots and recovery from the virus provided significant defense.

title: Free N95 Masks to Be Made Available at Pharmacies
summary: Distribution of 400 million masks comes as the Biden administration is also offering free rapid tests to combat the spread of Covid-19. WASHINGTON-The Biden administration on Wednesday announced plans to make 400 million N95 masks available for free at pharmacies and community health centers across the country.

title: Nasdaq Falls More Than 1%, Entering Correction Territory
summary: Tech shares finish the day with sharp decline; S&P 500, Dow also fall 1%. U.S. stocks gave up early gains and turned lower, extending a recent stretch of losses that have pulled major indexes down to start the year.

title: UnitedHealth Logs Steady Growth
summary: The healthcare giant's fourth-quarter results get boost from rising premium payments. UnitedHealth Group Inc. posted year-over-year earnings growth for the last three months of 2021, helped by higher revenue from premiums, and reaffirmed its financial projections for 2022.

title: Covid-19, Endemic or Not, Will Still Make Us Poorer
summary: More predictable, less deadly virus would continue to exact toll on health and work. The prospect that Covid-19 is transitioning from pandemic to endemic has brought out the bulls on Wall Street. "Meaningful upside to our medium-term economic outlook," writes Bank of America Corp. "A positive for risk assets," says JPMorgan Chase & Co. A "silver lining" of the "highly infectious" Omicron variant, says BlackRock Inc.

title: Supreme Court Weighs Ted Cruz's Campaign-Finance Battle
summary: Justices question federal limits on Cruz campaign reimbursing candidate's personal loan with postelection contributions. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court, weighing a legal battle involving Texas Sen. Ted Cruz, questioned federal limits on using political contributions received after an election to reimburse candidates for personal loans they made to their campaigns.

title: 'Machu Picchu and the Golden Empires of Peru' Review: Glittering, but Not Without Impurities
summary: An exhibition in Florida is overambitious in its approach to Andean history, but still offers visitors the chance to commune with captivating objects.

title: 'Gillian Wearing: Wearing Masks' Review: Turning a New Eye on the 'I'
summary: At the Guggenheim, the Conceptual artist questions the veracity of documentary photography and confessional videos. New York

title: ZoomInfo Adds Former U.K. Data-Protection Regulator as Compliance Chief
summary: Business-intelligence platform provider says Simon McDougall will advise company on privacy best practices. ZoomInfo Technologies Inc. has hired Simon McDougall as its first chief compliance officer.

title: Bank of America's Quarterly Profit Rises 28%
summary: Record investment-banking revenue and loan growth pushes fourth-quarter earnings higher. Bank of America Corp. profit rose 28% in the fourth quarter, boosted by record investment-banking revenue and recovering appetite for borrowing from businesses and consumers.

title: Morgan Stanley Profit Rises 9%
summary: Bank joins peers in posting gains in investment banking but decline in trading revenue. A booming market for deals and brisk demand for financial advice lifted Morgan Stanley 's fourth-quarter earnings and helped the Wall Street firm set a full-year profit record.

title: Trump Organization Falsely Valued Assets, New York Attorney General Says
summary: Ivanka Trump and Donald Trump Jr. have asked a judge to quash subpoenas or put them on hold until parallel criminal case concludes. The New York attorney general's office said late Tuesday it uncovered a swath of evidence that former President Donald Trump and his company falsely valued assets to obtain loans, insurance coverage and tax deductions.

title: German Benchmark Bond Yield Briefly Turns Positive for First Time Since 2019
summary: Rates globally are being pulled up by U.S. bond yields as investors anticipate faster inflation and more aggressive rate increases from the Federal Reserve. Europe's most closely watched government bond yield turned positive for the first time since 2019, part of a broad readjustment by investors to rising inflation and the global economic rebound from the pandemic.

title: More Businesses Biden Can Blame for Inflation
summary: The White House still hasn't explained why his inauguration triggered a year of greed.. The White House and congressional Democrats have decided that bashing businesses for rising prices is more politically useful than admitting Washington fault for the debt-fueled federal spending, misguided incentives and epic money creation that are driving inflation.

title: SEC Under Pressure to Implement Agenda in 2022
summary: After talking up an ambitious agenda, SEC Chairman Gensler is expected to begin implementing changes. WASHINGTON-Securities and Exchange Commission Chairman Gary Gensler spent his first nine months on the job sketching out ambitious plans to tighten federal regulation of Wall Street.

title: Enough Already! (Thursday Crossword, January 20)
Instagram Creators Can Charge for Subscriptions Under New Test Service
summary: Test in the U.S. will begin with a relatively small number of creators and expand in coming months, Instagram boss Adam Mosseri says. Instagram is launching trials of a subscription service that allows users to pay for extra content from creators, as social-media companies battle to attract individuals who can drive traffic to their platforms.

title: Russian Military Buildup Triggers European Defense Anxieties
summary: French President Emmanuel Macron takes helm of EU's rotating presidency with a call for Europe to chart its own defense course aside from NATO. PARIS-Russia's military buildup is rekindling tensions over whether Europe should take a bigger role in its own defense aside from the trans-Atlantic alliance with the U.S. that has underpinned the region's security in the postwar era.

title: Oil Demand to Exceed Pre-Covid Levels in 2022, IEA Says
summary: Paris-based agency says total demand this year should stand at 99.7 million barrels a day. Global oil demand will exceed pre-pandemic levels this year thanks to growing Covid-19 immunization rates and as recent virus waves haven't proved severe enough to warrant a return to strict lockdown measures, the International Energy Agency said Wednesday.

title: Competition for Compliance Officers Intensifies Amid Regulatory Pressures
summary: In a tight labor market, businesses are luring compliance staff with salary increases, remote-working opportunities and company equity. A labor-market squeeze and evolving regulatory pressures are driving demand for compliance officers.

title: These Workout Glasses Project Fitness Stats Right Into Your Sight Line
summary: We tested three pairs of futuristic frames to see whether they live up to their claims of promoting efficiency and safety. IF YOU'VE EVER struggled to glance at a running watch covered by layers of winter activewear or skipped peeking down at your bike's computer to navigate a busy road, you know how hard it can be to take advantage of your body's catalog of metrics during exercise. A new class of workout glasses may help streamline the process by tracking stats-such as speed, distance, elevation and power output-and flashing them before your eyes.

title: Disney Shakes Up Streaming Management, Forms International Hub
summary: Changes come amid slowing growth in sign-ups for company's marquee streaming service, Disney+. Walt Disney Co. said it is shaking up its streaming management and forming a new hub for international content creation as the company searches for further growth amid intense competition.

title: What to Watch: Six Series to Stream This Week
summary: Resume Subscription. Stanley Tucci is a treasure hunter at a publicly traded expedition company in "La Fortuna," and Hilary Duff is at the center of "How I Met Your Father." Plus, "Billions" returns without Axe. Here's where to stream them all.

title: Banks' Rising Expenses Don't Have to Be So Costly
summary: Investors need to stay focused on bank spending that doesn't scale with revenue, particularly in technology. They say you have to spend more money to make more money. But in banking, sometimes you don't really have to do anything at all.

title: University of Michigan to Pay $490 Million to Sexual Abuse Accusers
summary: More than 1,000 people alleged abuse by former university doctor Robert Anderson, who died in 2008. The University of Michigan is paying $490 million to settle allegations that a former university physician, Robert Anderson, sexually abused more than 1,000 former students, athletes and others.

title: Gorsuch, Sotomayor Counter Reports of Covid-19 Mask Tiff
summary: Supreme Court justices say 'we are warm colleagues and friends'. WASHINGTON-Supreme Court Justices Sonia Sotomayor and Neil Gorsuch issued a statement Wednesday tamping down reports that they are at odds over masking in the courthouse amid the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Actor Gaspard Ulliel Dies at Age 37 After Ski Accident
summary: César award-winning French actor was tapped to play Midnight Man in the new miniseries on Disney+. Gaspard Ulliel, a French actor set to appear in the coming Marvel series "Moon Knight," died following a ski accident. He was 37 years old.

title: Unilever Walks Away From Glaxo Consumer-Healthcare Deal
summary: Dove soap owner says it won't raise its $68 billion offer for the maker of Aquafresh toothpaste and Advil painkillers. Unilever PLC said it wouldn't increase its $68 billion offer for GlaxoSmithKline PLC's consumer-healthcare business, effectively walking away from a potential deal that would have added a raft of drugstore staples to its portfolio.

title: A Manhattan Townhouse Gets a One-of-Kind Makeover
summary: New York architect Adam Kushner bought a dilapidated property in Greenwich Village nine years ago and spent $2.5 million painstakingly renovating the historic property.. When Adam Kushner first saw the townhouse he now calls home in Greenwich Village, it was dilapidated and structurally chaotic, with no kitchen and numerous code issues that affected safety.

title: Starbucks Drops Covid-19 Vaccination, Testing Requirements
summary: Coffee chain makes change following Supreme Court ruling; says most workers are vaccinated. Starbucks Corp. said it will no longer require U.S. workers to be vaccinated against Covid-19 or undergo weekly testing by next month, after the Supreme Court recently blocked the Biden administration's mandate for large private employers.

title: Hillary Clinton for President? Not That Again
summary: The Democrats are not going to deny their nomination to a sitting president running for re-election.. Douglas Schoen and Andrew Stein posit that a midterm loss for the Democrats will set the stage for Hillary Clinton to make a run for the party's presidential nomination in 2024 ("Hillary Clinton's 2024 Comeback," op-ed, Jan. 12). But their analysis omits the near certainty that Republican control of the Senate or House will result in a thorough investigation of the role of Mrs. Clinton and her campaign in the Steele dossier, FISA court warrants and the Russian collusion allegations during Donald Trump's presidency. That investigation should end any thoughts of a Clinton candidacy.

title: Where Are the Covid Therapies, Mr. President?
summary: My nursing homes need Paxlovid.. Regarding your editorial "Biden's Operation Snail Speed" (Jan. 13): I am the medical director of several nursing homes in the Denver area. Residents (patients) are dying because we can't get any Paxlovid. The institutional pharmacies that supply medicines to the nursing homes tell me that they don't expect to receive any for the foreseeable future. It is not always feasible to transfer elderly residents to hospitals, which have their own challenges at the moment and may not have any Paxlovid anyway.

title: Cooking the Schoolbooks for Racial Purposes
summary: Kids 'in the rough' should be in educational settings where their gifts can be found.. In "An Ugly Game of Race Preferences" (Main Street, Jan. 11), William McGurn lays out the perniciousness of school policies that have the effect-and purpose-of reducing Asian-American student numbers in elite programs. I can tell you that I often heard unkind mutterings about Asian-Americans during school awards ceremonies when those children took a majority of awards. It was saddening and chilling.

title: Manufacturing Paper With Sustainability on the Mind
summary: Paper-product companies create more renewable bioenergy than any other industrial sector.. Saying that paperboard production consumes power and water and generates greenhouse gases conceals more than it reveals ("Packaging Giant Bets on Paper," Page One, Jan. 3). Paper manufacturing is water intensive, but it has become less so thanks to innovation and conservation efforts. Virtually all the water used in the manufacturing process is treated, cleaned and returned to the environment in line with strict regulations.

title: The CEO Who Fired 900 People on Zoom Is Back
summary: Better.com's Vishal Garg took a break in December after a video showing him letting go hundreds of employees remotely was posted online. Vishal Garg, the chief executive officer of Better.com who fired 900 workers on a Zoom call, is returning to his job.

title: Cars, Regulators and That Which Is Not Seen
summary: What would Bastiat say?. In his Jan. 7 letter regarding EPA mileage standards, David Melvin correctly argues that stricter regulation of cars resulted in technological advances. But some of these developments have been negative. For example, lighter cars have led to reduced safety of drivers and passengers.

title: Biden to Expand National Security Agency Role in Government Cybersecurity
summary: White House order mandates cybersecurity practices at Defense Department, spy agencies, contractors. WASHINGTON-President Biden on Wednesday expanded the National Security Agency's role in protecting the U.S. government's most sensitive computer networks, issuing a directive intended to bolster cybersecurity within the Defense Department and intelligence agencies.

title: The Smartest Ways to Use Your Smartphone Overseas
summary: How to maintain access to the internet while traveling abroad? A few tips.. GIVEN THE pandemic's twists and turns, picking a travel destination can be dicey these days-and the need to stay on top of potential obstacles has left globe-trotters extra-reliant on smartphones.

title: 'Full House' Creator Jeff Franklin Lists Beverly Hills Home for $85 Million
summary: The Manson Family's murder of Sharon Tate took place in a now-demolished home on the Cielo Drive property. Call it the house that "Full House" built.

title: Biden to Nominate Top Democratic Donors for Ambassador Posts in U.K., Brazil, Denmark
summary: President to tap Jane Hartley, Elizabeth Bagley and Alan Leventhal for diplomatic assignments. WASHINGTON-President Biden is turning to a trio of top Democratic donors to lead diplomatic posts in the United Kingdom, Brazil and Denmark, the White House said Wednesday.

title: Microsoft's Activision Deal to Power Its Netflix-of-Gaming Aspirations
summary: The $75 billion acquisition would give the software company a new pool of games and gamers to entice to its cloud. Microsoft Corp.'s acquisition of Activision Blizzard Inc. aims to shake up the game industry by expanding the software giant's library of blockbuster videogames and bolstering its efforts to entice consumers to its cloud-gaming service.

title: 8 Books on the Science of the Body and Brain
summary: Recommended reading that unlocks the universe within.. How is our consciousness shaped by our perceptions? Why does pain sometimes become pleasure? What's the line between eccentricity and mental illness? Some of the greatest and most urgent mysteries investigated by researchers are those involving our minds and bodies. Here are eight recent books discussed by WSJ reviewers that unpack the science of our inner worlds.

title: Biden Is Flailing, Literally and Figuratively
summary: The opposite, in both style and substance, of Reagan's calmly and confidently delivered message of unity.. After Joe Biden bitterly attacked Donald Trump only days before the inauguration, I urged the president-elect on these pages to follow Ronald Reagan's model by rising above intemperate remarks. Mr. Biden could "be the one who isn't petty, small and spiteful. He can stay out of squabbles, be a statesman, show honor, demonstrate how someone truly worthy of the office behaves."

title: Inflation Gives Biden an Incentive for a Bad Iran Deal
summary: Instead of the 'longer and stronger' pact promised a year ago, the White House is likely to roll out concessions.. What a difference a year can make. Last January the Biden administration came to power pledging to revive the 2015 Iran nuclear deal that his predecessor had abrogated. That, however, was supposed to be just the beginning. Incoming national security adviser Jake Sullivan insisted that doing so would be a prelude to a "longer and stronger" deal with Tehran. Fast forward 12 months, and the likeliest outcome of the Biden administration's diplomatic outreach is a compromise pact far less comprehensive and robust than the original.

title: The Growing Risk for Jews Who Show Their Jewishness
summary: Last weekend's hostage crisis at a Texas synagogue shows that today's anti-Semitism is most threatening to Jews who are religiously observant. It seems that violent attacks on Jews in the U.S. have become a regular occurrence, like natural disasters. There were deadly shootings at synagogues in Pittsburgh in October 2018 and Poway, Calif., in April 2019, then at a kosher market in Jersey City, N.J., in December 2019. Last weekend, a rabbi and three congregants were taken hostage at Congregation Beth Israel, a Reform synagogue near Fort Worth, Texas. After a standoff that lasted more than 10 hours and involved an elite FBI hostage rescue team, the Jews in the synagogue were freed unharmed and the perpetrator, identified by the FBI as Malik Faisal Akram, was killed.

title: Investors Aren't Sure About Home Builders' Foundations
summary: The market for new U.S. homes is surprisingly strong, in some ways exceeding the housing boom years, but investors have a few valid reasons to wait and see. This should be a great year for U.S. home builders. Convincing investors of that might take time.

title: Turkey Takes $5 Billion Lifeline From Old Rival U.A.E.
summary: Deal deepens detente between powers that until recently were adversaries in a Middle Eastern cold war. ISTANBUL-The United Arab Emirates and Turkey agreed to a currency swap equivalent to nearly $5 billion that reinforces an economic partnership between two Middle Eastern rivals and provides Ankara with a badly needed infusion of foreign funds.

title: How 'Encanto's' 'We Don't Talk About Bruno' Became Bigger Than 'Let It Go'
summary: The song, written by Lin-Manuel Miranda, from Disney's animated musical has been dubbed in 46 languages. Is someone you know singing about Bruno?

title: Foreign Investment Bounced Back Last Year but Did Little to Ease Supply Strains
summary: Investments by overseas businesses in the U.S. more than doubled; projects to expand factory capacity globally were down. Foreign investment by businesses around the world rebounded strongly last year to exceed its pre-pandemic total, but little of that U.S.-led surge went toward boosting manufacturing capacity despite the widespread shortages of goods that have helped push inflation to its highest rate in decades.

title: The Shirtless Tongan Olympian Raises Hundreds of Thousands of Dollars for Tonga Relief Aid
summary: Fundraising on GoFundMe page is expected to help victims and repair damaged infrastructure, schools and hospitals in island nation. Pita Taufatofua, who became internationally recognized for marching shirtless as Tonga's Olympic flag-bearer, has raised hundreds of thousands of dollars in a campaign aimed at aiding the island nation after a volcanic eruption and tsunami left it significantly damaged.

title: Do We Need N95 Masks to Protect Against Omicron?
summary: Cloth masks might not offer enough protection against fast-spreading variant. Here is what you need to know about stronger options.. Surging Covid-19 infections caused by the fast-spreading Omicron variant have increased the need for strong mask protection. Many scientists and doctors now say that the popular single-layer cloth masks might not be enough. Instead, they are recommending high-filtration masks such as N95s or similar alternatives.

title: Canada Inflation Reaches 30-Year High, Placing Spotlight on Central Bank
summary: Economists expect Bank of Canada to increase rates as early as next week based on CPI report, wage pressures reflected in business-outlook survey. OTTAWA-Canada's annual inflation rate edged upward in December to reach a three-decade high, a result that is bound to add pressure on the Bank of Canada to begin raising rates as early as next week.

title: Beijing 2022 Olympics Mobile App Is Marred by Security Flaws, Researchers Say
summary: Compulsory software potentially exposes sensitive personal data from athletes, officials and others, according to Citizen Lab. A mobile app that is mandatory for all participants in next month's Winter Olympics in Beijing contains security flaws that could make it easy for a hacker to steal sensitive personal information, cybersecurity researchers in Canada warn.

title: Top Colleges in the Midwest by Size
summary: Carleton, Northwestern and Michigan are leaders in the WSJ/THE College Rankings. Carleton College is the highest-ranked small college in the Midwest in the Wall Street Journal/Times Higher Education College Rankings, with Northwestern University leading the region's midsize schools and the University of Michigan-Ann Arbor the top large Midwestern school.

title: SoFi, Bakkt, Bank of America, Cisco: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
summary: SoFi Technologies was cleared by regulators to become a bank holding company; United Airlines is due to report results. Wall Street stock indexes rose, clawing back some of the losses from Tuesday's selloff. Here's what we're watching in Wednesday's trading:

title: Don't Mess with Texas Rabbis
summary: A courageous man stops a foreign terrorist.. Don't underestimate a good guy with a chair. On Saturday foreign terrorist Malik Faisal Akram learned the hard way that even an unarmed and welcoming man of faith can be a formidable adversary when his flock is threatened.

title: Cartier's Dazzling Festive Season Bodes Well for Luxury Stocks
summary: Richemont's sales grew 32% in the last three months of 2021, adding to signs of strong jewelry demand. Cartier gems likely made it into a record number of Christmas stockings last month. Bulgari and Tiffany & Co. should also benefit from sparkling demand for expensive jewelry.

title: 'As We See It' Review: Gaining Perspective on the Spectrum
summary: Amazon's comedy-drama about a trio of autistic young adults makes the case for compassion in a complicated world. "You need to be able to leave the building," Mandy (Sosie Bacon) tells her housebound client, Harrison (Albert Rutecki), one of the autistic characters in the comedy-drama "As We See It." Harrison, looking for a way out of going out, wants to know why. "So you can do things," Mandy argues. "Go see friends. Go to the movies. Shop." Has she been outside in a while? She's not making much of a case.

title: The Sex Advice We Should Take From Grandparents
summary: People in their 60s, 70s and beyond have practice keeping the spark alive. Here's how they do it.. Could your sex life be better? Ask grandparents for advice.

title: China Notifies Firms of Tougher Investment Rules for Big Tech
summary: Requiring tech firms to seek regulatory approval for investment deals, as regulator plans, could curb companies' growth. SINGAPORE-China has notified some companies of new rules that would require the country's biggest internet firms to seek approval for investment deals, a mechanism that is likely to curb domestic technology giants from growing even bigger through acquisitions, according to people familiar with the issue.

title: State Street Profit Rises on New Business, Market Gains
summary: Fourth-quarter net income rose to $697 million, or $1.78 a share. State Street Corp. said profit jumped in the fourth quarter, as market gains and new client wins brought in more fees for its asset-servicing business and its investment-management arm.

title: Boris Johnson Faces Rising Pressure Over Lockdown Party
summary: A number of Conservative lawmakers seek a confidence motion that threatens to oust the British prime minister; one defects. LONDON-British Prime Minister Boris Johnson faced rising political pressure over allegations that he broke lockdown rules by attending a drinks party in Downing Street, as some of his Conservative lawmakers strategized how to oust the British leader and one defected to the opposition Labour Party.

title: 'Fuccboi' is a Generation's Coming-of-Age Novel
summary: Thirty-year-old Sean Thor Conroe's forthcoming künstlerroman is characterized by egoism, Postmates deliveries and "side baes." It's utterly of its moment.. Every generation gets the coming-of-age novel it deserves. The term bildungsroman-literally "novel of education"-was coined in the 19th century, although Fielding's Tom Jones (1749) is often cited as an early example, along with Goethe's hugely popular and influential Wilhelm Meister's Apprenticeship, published in 1795 and 1796. Broadly speaking the term refers to novels about the transit from youth to adulthood, about the education and eventual integration of a young man or woman into the social order, although a sub-genre of the bildungsroman, the künstlerroman, or artist novel, often ends with the protagonist rejecting the values of conventional society in favor of an artistic vocation, Joyce's A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man being the classic example.

title: Sony Shares Fall Sharply on News of Microsoft Deal for Activision Blizzard
summary: Videogame giants compete on consoles and subscription services, and access to popular games could be an issue. Sony Group Corp.'s shares fell nearly 13% in Tokyo on Wednesday on concerns about new competition for its videogame business from the combination of Microsoft Corp. and Activision Blizzard Inc.

title: Biden Administration Steps Up Covid-19 Response, as Omicron Slows in Global Hotspots
summary: Biden administration is expected to announce plans to offer free N95 masks across the country. The Biden administration is stepping up the federal government's Covid-19 response amid tentative signs that regions that were hit early by the Omicron surge are seeing a slowdown in infections.

title: Bonds Sometimes Don't Make Sense
summary: German bunds have moved in lockstep with Treasurys, pushing yields positive for the first time since 2019, but this goes against the divergence in thinking at the Fed and the ECB. A bond movie can sometimes lose the plot.

title: A Secret Interior Design Trick: Wallpapering a Closet
summary: Adding pattern to a closet makes putting things away less dreary by turning the space into a giant jewel box-with storage that will make you smile. WANT TO GIVE your décor a pop of personality that is both discrete and powerful? Take wallpaper inside your closet, a favorite interior-designer trick that's playful, surprising and easy on the budget. You do still have to consider the context, however. When adding a motif to a room, Jewel Marlowe, a Washington, D.C., interior designer and DIYer, categorizes patterns into stripes, dots, watercolors, organic and geometric. "If my closet is in a striped room, for example, I would choose a dot, watercolor, organic or geometric with a different scale for my closet for more visual interest." Here, some other particulars.

title: The Calculators Behind the Music-Catalog Megadeals
summary: Massarsky Consulting's team of four economists sold its business after valuing over $6.5 billion worth of music rights last year. As investors rush to buy megastars' music catalogs, Barry Massarsky and his firm are in the middle valuing most of the deals.

title: Freight Operators Plan to Deploy Thousands of Remote-Operated Forklifts
summary: ArcBest and NFI Industries led a $42 million investment in Phantom Auto and its technology aimed at expanding the pool of workers in a tight labor market. Two big freight operators are betting on technology that allows workers to operate forklifts remotely as the distribution sector confronts persistent labor shortages.

title: Texas Election Law Leads Officials to Reject More Mail-in Ballot Applications
summary: New law being tested as state prepares for March 1 primary. AUSTIN, Texas-Texas counties say confusion stemming from a new state election law is leading them to reject an unusually high proportion of applications for mail-in ballots.

title: The NBA Player Shooting His Way From Undrafted to Undervalued
summary: Few players have improved their 3-point shooting more than Dorian Finney-Smith of the Dallas Mavericks. It changed everything about his career.. One of the many things that makes playing basketball for a living different from other lines of work is the radical pay transparency in professional sports. Salaries are not secret. NBA players come to an office in which colleagues, rivals and the fans who review their job performance know exactly how much money they make.

title: This Year's Australian Open Is Quiet-and Fans Don't Mind It That Way
summary: Organizers limit crowd capacity at 50% on main courts amid pandemic. 'We can hear the coaches. We never hear the coaches.'. MELBOURNE, Australia-There is a lot different about this year's Australian Open and not just the forced absence of defending men's champion Novak Djokovic. Players and fans have been taken aback by something unusual for a tennis major: There are few people, and it is often quiet.

title: Wildfire Risk in California Drives Insurers to Pull Policies for Pricey Homes
summary: AIG and Chubb are cutting back on coverage of multimillion-dollar homes, following years of non-renewals by midrange insurers. Worried about wildfire exposure and frustrated by state regulations, insurers in California have been cutting back on their homeowner businesses. Now, affluent homeowners are feeling more of the pain, as two of the biggest firms offering protection for multimillion-dollar properties end coverage for some customers.

title: Fetch Rewards Hires Facebook Retail Executive as Its First Customer Chief
summary: The shopper rewards startup plans to expand its corporate partnerships and user base following a SoftBank investment. Fetch Rewards Inc., a SoftBank-backed consumer rewards company, has named David Sommer as its first chief customer officer, the company said.

title: Betty White Fans Flood Animal-Rescue Groups With Donations
summary: Social-media campaign turns late star's 100th birthday into giving challenge for her favorite cause. What would have been Betty White's 100th birthday turned into a celebration for animal-rescue groups and shelter organizations across the U.S.

title: U.K. Inflation Hits 30-Year High, Prompting Expectations of Rise in Interest Rates
summary: Consumer prices rise 5.4% in December amid supply-chain disruptions, tight labor market and higher energy prices. LONDON-Consumer prices in the U.K. rose at the fastest annual rate in nearly three decades last month, strengthening the case for further increases in the Bank of England's key interest rate as the country's economy emerges from the Omicron wave.

title: China Detains Prominent Activists as Olympics Near, Citing State Security
summary: Detention of free-speech advocate Yang Maodong, missing since December, is confirmed days after wife's death from cancer in the U.S.. TAIPEI-Chinese authorities have detained two prominent human-rights activists, quietly intensifying a crackdown on dissent weeks before Beijing hosts the most politicized Winter Olympics in recent memory.

title: Sony Braces for Microsoft's 'Pay-to-Win' Strategy
summary: Sony shares dropped nearly 13% after Microsoft's announced megadeal for Activision. Its investors are right to be concerned.. Microsoft is flashing its wallet to bulk up in games. That adds up to a fearsome boss battle for Sony, Microsoft's rival in videogame consoles.

title: To Help Fight Covid-19, a Hospital Borrows Tactics From Combat Veterans
summary: Resume Subscription. CHICAGO-At Rush University Medical Center, nurses still talk about their feelings of guilt from the early months of treating Covid-19 patients. How they hadn't known how to best treat desperate patients. How worried they were about bringing Covid-19 home to their families.

title: How to Navigate Rising Food Prices as Inflation Surges
summary: Planning your grocery store trips and making smart substitutes are just a couple of strategies to help you with rising prices. Sticker shock is becoming a regular feature of many consumers' grocery store trips. Given it is unlikely to dissipate anytime soon, consumers should evaluate changes to their shopping habits.

title: Big Tech and Foes Spar Over Bill to Curb Market Power of Dominant Internet Platforms
summary: Tech lobby launches ad campaign to block bipartisan bill by Klobuchar, Grassley. WASHINGTON-Big technology companies and their critics are ramping up lobbying efforts in Congress this week as a key Senate panel takes up legislation that seeks to blunt the market power of dominant tech platforms.

title: Influential Fashion Journalist André Leon Talley Dies at 73
summary: A regular on the front rows of fashion shows in New York and Europe who worked at Women's Wear Daily and Vogue. NEW YORK-André Leon Talley, the towering former creative director and editor at large of Vogue magazine, has died. He was 73.

title: North Korea's Missiles and Nuclear Weapons: Everything You Need to Know
summary: Kim Jong Un vows to continue advancing an arsenal that has the potential to hit anywhere in the U.S.. North Korea sees its nuclear program as essential to regime survival, serving to deter a U.S.-led invasion. Decades of denuclearization talks, economic sanctions and diplomacy have done little to slow Pyongyang's advance to becoming a self-declared nuclear state.

title: Covid-19 Claims a Big Cruise-Line Victim
summary: Insolvency of shipbuilding unit put $2.8 billion of company's debt in cross default. Cruise operator Genting Hong Kong Ltd. sought court approval to appoint outside professionals to help lead a restructuring, becoming the industry's highest-profile financial casualty since the onset of the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Apple Says Senate Tech Bill Would Hurt Its Privacy Push
summary: Ahead of Thursday debate in Congress, iPhone maker says measure could benefit 'irresponsible' companies profiting from user data. Apple Inc. is warning that Senate legislation aimed at reining in large tech companies would weaken a privacy-protection tool that it rolled out last year and has already stung Facebook , Snapchat and other online-ad businesses reliant on user data to target messages.

title: Sanders Open to Primary Challenges to Sinema, Manchin
summary: Democrats are frustrated with their moderate colleagues' stance on filibuster rules, Biden's agenda. WASHINGTON-Sen. Bernie Sanders said he would be open to supporting primary challenges to Sens. Kyrsten Sinema of Arizona and Joe Manchin of West Virginia over the two Democrats' refusal to support a pair of party priorities, a rare move for a sitting senator.

title: China's Lending Comes Under Fire as Sri Lankan Debt Crisis Deepens
summary: The crunch opens a window for India to push back against Chinese influence in the Indian Ocean region. A deepening debt crisis has left Sri Lanka struggling to pay for imports and stoked political controversy over Chinese lending to the South Asian nation as part of Beijing's global Belt and Road infrastructure program.

title: How China's Zero-Covid Policies Are Disrupting Cross-Border Trade
summary: Trucks laden with Vietnamese produce are backed up at border crossings as China endeavors to contain the spread of Covid-19. China's zero-Covid policies are putting Chinese cities into lockdown and grounding air travel anew. They are also disrupting trade routes across its land borders that are lifelines for the region's farmers and merchants.

title: Puerto Rico Released From Bankruptcy as Problems Persist
summary: A federal judge approved the largest-ever restructuring of U.S. municipal bonds, easing the island's re-entry to capital markets. Puerto Rico received court approval to leave bankruptcy through the largest restructuring of U.S. municipal debt ever, ending years of conflict with creditors as the U.S. territory confronts other stubborn economic problems.

title: Democrats Pursue 'Talking Filibuster' as Elections Bill Stalled
summary: With Sens. Kyrsten Sinema and Joe Manchin opposed to changes in procedures, leadership sets in motion a last-ditch effort. WASHINGTON-Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer (D., N.Y.) set in motion a plan to require senators to speak on the floor if they want to block Democrats' elections bill, a proposed change to the chamber's filibuster rule intended as a last-ditch effort to pass the legislation.

title: Activision Blizzard's Workplace Problems Spurred $75 Billion Microsoft Deal
summary: After a lawsuit and a Journal report, the company's stock was falling, board members were getting anxious-and the tech giant was ready to take a gamble. When allegations of a toxic workplace at Activision Blizzard Inc. surfaced last year and investors fled the video-gaming giant's stock, Microsoft Corp. rushed in.

title: Hong Kong Activist Who Inspired Violent Resistance Released From Jail
summary: Edward Leung's call for forceful opposition resonated with young protesters in 2019; his campaign slogan is now banned. HONG KONG-Activist Edward Leung rose to prominence on the now-banned slogan "Liberate Hong Kong, Revolution of Our Times," but he didn't get to see it become a rallying cry during the city's mass protests in 2019.

title: Airlines Cancel Some Flights Ahead of 5G Wireless Launch
summary: Flight suspensions occur even as AT&T and Verizon agree to limit signals within 2 miles of runways to address air-safety concerns. Two of the biggest U.S. wireless operators agreed to not turn on some 5G signals near airport runways, a temporary concession to address air-safety concerns that have already prompted international airlines to cancel some U.S.-bound flights.

title: Microsoft's Activision Deal May Bring 'Metaverse' to Enterprise Tech
summary: Videogames have already had an outsize influence on corporate technology in areas like cloud-computing, AI, virtual marketplaces and cryptocurrency. In a union of Microsoft and Activision, much more would be on the way, analysts say. Microsoft Corp.'s planned acquisition of videogame giant Activision Blizzard Inc. is poised to bring more of the sleek innovations of the online-gaming sector into the world of enterprise information technology, analysts say.

title: Gorillas Hires CMO as Rapid-Grocery-Delivery Race Speeds Up
summary: Luanne Calvert will lead the global marketing team at Berlin-based Gorillas. Gorillas Technologies Ltd. has hired Luanne Calvert as chief marketing officer as the company tries to solidify its brand in the increasingly competitive rapid-grocery-delivery space.

title: Rudy Giuliani, Jenna Ellis Subpoenaed by Jan. 6 Committee
summary: Panel investigating Capitol riot seeks records and testimony from Trump associates. WASHINGTON-The committee investigating last year's attack on the U.S. Capitol said it has issued subpoenas to longtime Donald Trump adviser Rudy Giuliani, the former president's campaign lawyer Jenna Ellis and two other people who the panel said participated in attempts to disrupt or delay the certification of the 2020 election results.
